text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Defence Minister Ben Mwila has warned Zairean soldiers on Zambian soil to surrender themselves to local authorities or return to their country before the government is compelled to deal with them.
- Colossals Resource Corps cobalt project in the central towm of Kabwe is officialy commissioned.
- The government is holding 10 Zairean government officials and two Burundese soldiers after finding them in possession of firearms.
- The government orders illegal vendors to move from strategic parts of the city to a designated market area near two residential areas.
- Outgoing director of public prosecutions Gregory Phiri defends police actions in tapping the telephones of an independent newspaper.
- Fourteen people involved in a car accident en route from a church service on Sunday are battling for their lives in hospital.
